DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Brain Stem And/Or Cerebellum Involvement Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the brain stem and/or cerebellum regions of the brain were involved.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Brain Stem And/Or Cerebellum Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a malignant neoplasm (a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues) involved (sharing in an activity or process) in the brain stem (the portion of the brain located at the base of the skull that is responsible for balance, equilibrium and movement) and/or (used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid) the cerebellum (the part of the brain that is connected to the spinal cord) areas of the brain (an organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The part of the brain that is connected to the spinal cord.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:The portion of the brain located at the base of the skull that is responsible for balance, equilibrium and movement.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: Three sections, the midbrain, pons and medulla oblongata, that are located at the base of the brain. The brain stem regulates the central nervous system, and is vital as a conduit for motor and sensory innervations.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The portion of the brain located at the base of the skull that is responsible for balance, equilibrium and movement.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
